intro: Chiropetalum anisotrichum, commonly known as the slender-flowered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in rocky or limestone soils. It is typically perennial and grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of botanical circles.
